Coming from a 62 year old I sometimes enjoy the genre and sometimes I think it is unadulterated crap. If inflaming with specific words is Art I sometimes don't see it. N word this, F this and that. Can't one evoke emotion within me without this type of language? Art in my opinion is evoking an emotion from a person, listening, seeing, touching, watching.  This is supposed to be a G rated site. I'm sure Art hasn't seen most of this stuff. It sure is as or more inflammatory than criticizing politicians.  It is a long way from when I was a kid watching American Bandstand. "Yes Dick, it has a nice beat and I can dance to it easy'. That was mostly crap too. You never saw Hendrix on ABS. Now I must say, I do like most Hip Hop, it is the poetry today that was once the poetry of the 60's even into the 70's, including Mitchel, Dylan, Jagger and Lennon and McCartney et all. I get that. The language used throughout most Hip Hop is not needed to get the blood flowing in someone listening, to evoke emotion, is distain an emotion? I think the language is just a crutch for bad music often.  That just my old greying head's opinion.
Alot of hip hop doesnt use excessive foul language, lots does.  Rap however, well i urge you to stear clear, especially "gangsta rap", oh or Necro lol

can someone get this guy some positive rap please?  Iron, here is the complete opposite end of the spectrum, have a listen    Iron, to be honest, most hip-hop is a product of its environment. The swearing is not in the music simply because its trying to sound tough...the music literally is a reflection of the streets that its growing up on.  Think of how guys on the job site spoke. Same thing. Big L laid it out simply "speak with criminal slang, thats just the way that i talk yo".    Big L wasnt rapping like this as an act...dude grew up in harlem and was a gangster through and through...both him and his brother were murdered.  Obviously it can be very difficult to connect with someone's whos reality is the streets, but thats what makes it appealing, its like someone telling a story about something that you couldnt imagine living. You obviously dont have to like it, but thats the reason for the language, these guys know no different.
also this track is for you manitou...i know youve been hurting so this track will get your ass up    that ending though "we need to go back in time to when muhfukas could rock"

I have seen them 3 times and the most legendary being at El Macumbo...thes took me and my homies hats off and freestyled about them.  I then met Thes at a hero burger before a PUTS show at the annex wreckroom lol.  I had a hat on that i bought from honest ed's that said "high roller" and i did graffiti on the beak that said "come on down" (referencing PUTS' obsession with the price is right   I went up to Thes and introduced myself and he asked me about the hat and i explained what was up...he said hold up i gotta do something...takes my hat and proceeds to draw THES ONE PUTS in graffiti on the hat...its now hanging on my wall

This thread brings back memories?  Akr thats sick!  At one point I had this big cd binder, 2500 hip hop albums. This was before ebay or amazon.  That was my baby... so many gems in there. On every skateboard trip I searched out local shops cause then these cds were hard to find(especially company flows funcrusher plus)  And one day it was ghost. My ex sold it when she was hard into drugs.  Man that killed me.  I still sketch bombs too but my train days are long over lol.  I cant even cursive write anymore I write in tag hahahaha
